intro: Guizotia ringoetii, commonly known as the ringoet's guizotia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
